TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS:  Loamy-skeletal, carbonatic, shallow Duric Xeric Petrocryids

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Leatherman very gravelly loam in an area of rangeland (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
A--0 to 13 cm; pale brown (10YR 6/3) very gravelly loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak very fine and fine subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and few fine roots; many very fine tubular and irregular pores; 35 percent gravel; calcium carbonate and silica coatings on bottom of rock fragments; strongly effervescent (50 percent calcium carbonate equivalent); slightly alkaline (pH 7.8); clear wavy boundary
Bk--13 to 28 cm; yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) very gravelly loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; weak very fine and fine subangular blocky structure; soft, loose, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and fine roots; common very fine irregular pores and few very fine tubular pores; 55 percent gravel; calcium carbonate and silica coatings on bottom of rock fragments; violently effervescent (60 percent calcium carbonate equivalent); moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); abrupt wavy boundary
2Bkqm--28 to 41 cm; light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) indurated duripan that has a laminar cap less than 2 mm thick, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; massive; 70 percent gravel and 5 percent cobbles; violently effervescent; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); clear wavy boundary
2Bkq--41 to 150 cm; light gray (10YR 7/2) extremely gravelly loamy sand, pale brown (10YR 6/3) moist; single grain; loose; many very fine and fine irregular pores; 65 percent gravel and 15 percent cobbles; calcium carbonate and silica coatings on bottom of rock fragments; violently effervescent (50 percent calcium carbonate equivalent); moderately alkaline (pH 8.4)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Custer County, Idaho; latitude 44.33722 degrees north, longitude 113.78111 degrees west, datum WGS 84

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--2.8 to 6.1 degrees C
Depth to duripan--25 to 50 cm
Depth to calcic horizon--10 to 25 cm
Particle-size control section (weighted averages)
Clay content--12 to 20 percent
Total rock fragment content--35 to 55 percent
Calcium carbonate equivalent--40 to 65 percent
A horizon
Value--5 or 6 dry, 3 to 5 moist
Chroma--2 to 4 dry, 3 or 4 moist
Clay content--12 to 27 percent
Total rock fragment content--20 to 45 percent
Gravel content--10 to 45 percent
Cobble content--0 to 5 percent
Reaction--pH 7.4 to 9.0
Thickness--8 to 20 cm
Bk horizon
Value--5 or 6 dry, 3 or 4 moist
Chroma--3 or 4 dry or moist
Clay content--12 to 26 percent
Total rock fragment content--30 to 60 percent
Gravel content--30 to 60 percent
Cobble content--0 to 5 percent
Reaction--pH 7.9 to 9.0
Thickness--10 to 23 cm
Bkqm horizon
Value--6 or 7 dry, 3 to 5 moist
Chroma--2 to 4 dry or moist
Thickness--13 to 38 cm
Bkq horizon
Value--6 or 8 dry, 5 or 6 moist
Chroma--2 or 3 dry or moist
Texture (less than 2-mm fraction)--loamy coarse sand, loamy sand, sandy loam
Clay content--3 to 10 percent
Total rock fragment content--60 to 85 percent
Gravel content--45 to 70 percent
Cobble content--5 to 25 percent
Reaction--pH 7.9 to 9.0

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--1820 to 2450 m
Mean annual precipitation--200 to 425 mm
Mean annual air temperature--1.7 to 5.6 degrees C
Frost-free period--30 to 60 days

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--well drained
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--5 to 25 um/sec above the duripan, 0.01 to 0.10 um/sec in the duripan

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Major use--rangeland
Potential natural vegetation--low sagebrush, black sagebrush, bluebunch wheatgrass

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Small extent in east-central Idaho; MLRAs 11, 12, and 13

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE:  Portland, Oregon

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features recognized in this pedon
Ochric epipedon
Calcic horizon--zone from 13 to 28 cm (Bk horizon)
Duripan--zone from 28 to 41 cm (2Bkqm horizon)
Particle-size control section--zone from the surface to a depth of 28 cm (A and Bk horizons)
Taxonomic version--Twelfth Edition, 2014
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
